main event: A member of the Army Air Forces Intelligence staff reported seeing a strange object in Hoffesville, Pennsylvania on March 21, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as a clear acute light, the apparent size of a pinpoint in the sky, that flashed on and off for 3 hours.
The object was observed from takeoff until landing for 4 consecutive nights from 2145 until 0235.
The object had a landing field that was black painted white, and was visible for the last 3-4 minutes.
The object's angles were recorded as 3735 South, 233 Watch, and 253 Lami Elev.
The object returned to Elgin Fields, parked, and had a flame altitude of 2212, SS 235, and 39.
sighted object: a clear acute light, the apparent size of a pinpoint in the sky, that flashed on and off
witnesses: a member of the Army Air Forces Intelligence staff
